result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice D Rimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Per judicial authority, posted cash bond applied to costs.

Defendant to submit DNA sample; pay $250 surcharge.
No contact with victim.
No internet access.
Sex offender rules and counseling as set by agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Huber suspended from 6/16 to 7/1/2016 Revoke transfer to Dane Cty.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant Maurice D Rimmer in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed; reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, defendant placed on 3 years probation. Conditions: Sex offender rules and counseling as set by agent. No internet access. No contact with victim.  Six months jail commencing June 1, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08. Transfer to Dane County Jail granted. Court costs of $518 & $278. Submit DNA sample.  5 days jail credit. Count 1 read in and dismissed. Case called 1:25 p.m., adjourned 2:25 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Filed by ADA Brenda Yaskal,  requesting a reset of the jury trials on 15CF322 and 14CF444 and requesting 15CF188 stay on for 5-12 and 5-13 due to demand for speedy trial.  This will remain on at this time.  Re-evaluate in mid April.
Atty. Nagel requests April 20, 2016 jury trial be reset - out of town - fax
Filed by ADA Brenda Yaskal  requesting a reset of the Jury Trial on 4/14/16 and or 4/15/16 due to a calendar conflict.
ADA Yaskal requests Jan. 14 & 15, 2016 jury trial be reset. Witness not available.
Jury trial on August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Robert Nagel - faxed

Defendant Maurice D Rimmer in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness.  Direct examination.  Cross examination. Court found probable cause, defendant bound over.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Regarding Conds. of Release filed. Bond amended: Defendant may have contact with M.M.R and J.L.A., all other conds. remain in effect
Defendant may have contact with M.M.R and J.L.A., all other conds. remain in effect
